SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddEvent
The AddEvent class implements the Operation interface and handles the addition of a new event to the EventBooker.
AddEventCommand
The AddEventCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Booking
The `Booking` class implements the `Operation` interface and handles the "bookings" operation, which involves listing all booked seats for events.
BookingCommand
The BookingCommand class implements the Commands interface.
BookSeat
The `BookSeat` class implements the `Operation` interface and handles the process of booking a seat for a specific event.
BookSeatCommand
The BookSeatCommand class implements the Commands interface.
BuyTicket
The BuyTicket class implements the Operation interface and handles the purchasing of tickets for a specified event.
BuyTicketCommand
The BuyTicketCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Check
The Check class implements the Operation interface and handles the validation of ticket codes.
CheckCommand
The CheckCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Close
The Close class implements the Operation interface and defines the behavior for closing a file.
CloseCommand
The CloseCommand class implements the Commands interface.
CommandNames
Enumeration representing various command names used in the system.
Commands
The Commands interface defines the method for executing commands within the system.
Event
Represents an event with a specific date, name, and location (hall).
EventBooker
The EventBooker class is responsible for managing a list of events.
EventException
The EventException class is a custom exception that extends RuntimeException.
Exit
The Exit class implements the Operation interface and defines the behavior for exiting the program.
ExitCommand
The ExitCommand class implements the Commands interface.
FileException
The FileException class is a custom exception that extends RuntimeException.
FreeSeats
The FreeSeats class implements the Operation interface and handles the retrieval of free seats information for a given event.
FreeSeatsCommand
The FreeSeatsCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Hall
The Hall class represents a venue where events are held.
Halls
The Halls class manages a collection of halls.
Help
The Help class implements the Operation interface and defines the behavior for displaying help information about available commands.
HelpCommand
The HelpCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Invoker
The Invoker class manages and executes commands within the application.
Main
The entry point of the application.
MostFamous
The `MostFamous` class implements the `Operation` interface and is responsible for identifying the most popular event based on the total number of tickets sold.
MostFamousCommand
The MostFamousCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Open
The `Open` class is responsible for processing the "open" operation.
OpenCommand
The OpenCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Operation
The Operation interface represents an operation that can be performed with the EventBooker and Halls.
Pair<T,K>
A generic class representing a pair of values.
Report
The Report class implements the Operation interface and generates a report of tickets sold for events within a specified date range.
ReportCommand
The ReportCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Row
The Row class represents a row of seats in a hall.
Save
The Save class implements the Operation interface and defines the behavior for saving event data to a file.
SaveAs
The SaveAs class implements the Operation interface and defines the behavior for saving event data to a new file.
SaveAsCommand
The SaveAsCommand class implements the Commands interface.
SaveCommand
The SaveCommand class implements the Commands interface.
Seat
The Seat class represents a seat in a row within a hall.
StatisticForTenPercent
The StatisticForTenPercent class is responsible for processing events and performing statistical analysis based on ticket sales.
StatisticForTenPercentCommand
The StatisticForTenPercentCommand class implements the Commands interface.
ThereIsNoSuchEvent
The `ThereIsNoSuchEvent` class is a custom runtime exception that is thrown when a requested event does not exist.
ThereIsNoSuchHall
The `ThereIsNoSuchHall` class is a custom runtime exception that is thrown when a requested hall does not exist.
ThereIsNoSuchSeat
The `ThereIsNoSuchSeat` class is a custom runtime exception that is thrown when a requested seat does not exist.
Ticket
The Ticket class represents a ticket issued for a seat in a hall.
TicketException
The TicketException class is a custom exception that extends RuntimeException.
UnbookSeat
The UnbookSeat class implements the Operation interface and provides functionality to unbook a seat for a specific event.
UnbookSeatCommand
The UnbookSeatCommand class implements the Commands interface.
